verses.text: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him, Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Set thine house in order ; for thou shalt die , and not live.\f + \fr 20.1 \ft Set…: Heb. Give charge concerning thine house\f*
Then he turned his face to the wall , and prayed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,

I beseech thee, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart , and have done \add that which is\add* good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.\f + \fr 20.3 \ft sore: Heb. with a great weeping\f*
And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court , that the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came to him, saying ,\f + \fr 20.4 \ft court: or, city\f*

Turn again , and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people , Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the God of David thy father , I have heard thy prayer , I have seen thy tears : behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And I will add unto thy days fifteen years ; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria ; and I will defend this city for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
And Isaiah said , Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid \add it\add* on the boil , and he recovered. \p

¶ And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah , What \add shall be\add* the sign that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* the third day ?

And Isaiah said , This sign shalt thou have of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will do the thing that he hath spoken : shall the shadow go forward ten degrees , or go back ten degrees ?
And Hezekiah answered , It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees : nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.

And Isaiah the prophet cried unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward , by which it had gone down in the dial of Ahaz.\f + \fr 20.11 \ft dial: Heb. degrees\f* \p

¶ At that time Berodach-baladan , the son of Baladan , king of Babylon , sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah : for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.\f + \fr 20.12 \ft Berodach-baladan: or, Merodach-baladan\f*

And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things , the silver , and the gold , and the spices , and the precious ointment , and \add all\add* the house of his armour , and all that was found in his treasures : there was nothing in his house , nor in all his dominion , that Hezekiah shewed them not.\f + \fr 20.13 \ft precious things: or, spicery\f*\f + \fr 20.13 \ft armour: or, jewels: Heb. vessels\f* \p

¶ Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah , and said unto him, What said these men ? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said , They are come from a far country , \add even\add* from Babylon.

And he said , What have they seen in thine house ? And Hezekiah answered , All \add the things\add* that \add are\add* in mine house have they seen : there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.
And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah , Hear the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Behold, the days come , that all that \add is\add* in thine house , and that which thy fathers have laid up in store unto this day , shall be carried into Babylon : nothing shall be left , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget , shall they take away ; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.

Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah , Good \add is\add* the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which thou hast spoken. And he said , \add Is it\add* not \add good\add*, if peace and truth be in my days ?\f + \fr 20.19 \ft Is it…: or, Shall there not be peace and truth, etc\f* \p

¶ And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah , and all his might , and how he made a pool , and a conduit , and brought water into the city , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah ?
And Hezekiah slept with his fathers : and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
